results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force and Harry Rayner
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: RAAF heritage
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett and Stanley Dalby
results.brief_description: The history of the Royal Australian Air Force and the original Australian Flying Corps, showing action in World Wars I and II, Korea, Malaya and Vietnam.

results.title: RAAF Base Butterworth
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force and Harry Rayner
results.brief_description: Life on the RAAF base at Butterworth, Malaya. British, Australian and Malayan personnel; relationships with the local people; provision for family life and recreation; the wives and children and airmen; servicing and flying aircraft; training exercises; practice with the one-man dinghy; the airmen as ambassadors.

results.title: Ra: the path of the sun god: a vision of ancient Egypt
results.creator_credit: Persistent Vision, Channel Four, Scottish Film Production Board, Jan Culik and Lesley Keen
results.brief_description: A three part program which combines traditional animation techniques with special optical effects to produce a dream-like evocation of ancient Egyptian beliefs about the Creation and man’s place within it. The use of symbols to recreate the mental and spiritual world of the ancient Egyptians, transports the viewer to a zone which has more in common with Jung than popular notions of the ancient Egyptians. The parts are: “Dawn: the Creation”; “Noon: the year of the king” and “Night: the gates of the underworld”.

results.title: R.A.A.F. Newsreel. No. 13. The Queen and the R.A.A.F
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations and H Rayner
results.brief_description: Screen magazine: Commemorates the important part played by the R.A.A.F. during the visit of Her Majesty the Queen and His Royal Highness, the Duke of Edinburgh to Australia, February 1963. Providing air transport in an R.A.A.F. Convair; immaculate guards of honour; exhibitions of precise formation flying and performance by the R.A.A.F. Central Band.

results.title: Quo Vadis
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sam Zimbalist and Mervyn LeRoy
results.brief_description: Describes Rome at the time of Nero, focusing on a Roman commander who falls in love with a Christian girl and becomes a convert himself. A spectacular film, at its most effective where it examines the lives of the early Christians. The Miklos Rozsa score was based on music of the time. Starring Deborah Kerr, Robert Taylor and Peter Ustinov.

results.title: Quiz show
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Michael Jacobs, Julian Krainin, Michael Nozik and Robert Redford
results.brief_description: Ralph Fiennes and John Turturro play contestants battling for huge cash prizes and instant fame on a top-rated quiz show in the mid-1950s. When charges surface that the hit program is fixed and players are being given the answers, it becomes far more than a game. Contestants, producers and the network itself get caught in the centre of an escalating scandal. Nominated for the 1994 Best Picture Academy Award and based on a true story that shocked the United States, this is a very compelling film.

results.title: Quintet
results.brief_description: Members of the Victorian Wind Quintet, working in the Music Teachers Project at Bendigo, demostrate the flute, clarinet, oboe, french horn and bassoon. Introduced by Trevor Lunn.

results.title: Quintet
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: Robert Altman’s “Quintet” was received with almost universal derision when it was released in 1979. He had made his reputation with very contemporary, very insisive and very American films. “Quintet” is strikingly different: heavily symbolic, with a mannerist visual palette, it was a departure for Altman and sees him explore themes associated with European existentialism. In a desolate future Ice-Age the remaining inhabitants of Earth are facing their extinction. Paul Newman plays a hunter, returning to his birthplace, accompanied by a pregnant woman (a startling occurrence in a world where most people are no longer able to reproduce). Her murder leads him to a confrontation with the players of Quintet, an elaborate and violent game which is the main activity of the future. As he becomes more involved in the strategies and rules of Quintet, he finds himself losing his identity. This complex and philosophical science-fiction film, creates a future as it may have been envisaged by Kafka and is a uniquely original meditation on the struggle and meaning of human “free will”. Undeniably difficult and ambitious, the film deserves a more serious critical engagement than that offered by contemporary English-language critics. Also stars Vittorio Gassman, Bibi Anderson and Fernando Rey.

results.title: Quintessence: five short films by Barry J. Hershey
results.creator_credit: Waldon Woods Film and Barry J Hersey
results.brief_description: This meditative exploration by filmmaker Barry J. Hersey presents life in a visual poetry. Themes of life, birth, death and spirit fill each piece. Form and substance are explored. Reality and art are questioned as we journey through the spiritually observant eyes of the filmmaker. Each piece reveals the different and crucial aspects of the human condition and the place or insignificance of a person on earth. The nature and contours of the landscape are seen through new eyes while the suggestive ocean offers deeper interpretations of the world around us. The filmmaker makes use of the effects that music has on the visual experience with dreamy and relaxing sounds unifying the meditative aspects of this style of filmmaking.
